title: France’s Far Right Scores Big in First Round of Elections, Polling Suggests
description: A surprise decision by President Emmanuel Macron to hold a snap election appears to have backfired badly, giving the National Rally a decisive victory.

title: Four Takeaways From France’s Snap Election
description: It was a big day for the far-right National Rally. Just how big will not be clear until a second round of voting is over.

title: Biden’s Family Tells Him to Keep Fighting as They Huddle at Camp David
description: President Biden is trying to figure out how to tamp down Democratic anxiety after last week’s disastrous debate performance.

title: Nothing to See Here? White House Portrays Biden’s Debate Performance as a Blip
description: Critics of the approach say it risks making President Biden and his campaign seem woefully out of touch with the voters they need to win.

title: Democrats Roll Out a Post-Debate Playbook to Help Biden Recover
description: Surrogates on Sunday made the case for the president, who spent the weekend reassuring donors and supporters, with a message focused on his record and that of Donald J. Trump.

title: Can Japan’s First Same-Sex Dating Reality Show Change Hearts and Minds?
description: Producers of “The Boyfriend” on Netflix hope it will encourage broader acceptance of the L.G.B.T.Q. community in Japan, which still has not legalized same-sex unions.

title: U.S.A. Gymnastics Uses Therapy Dogs at Olympic Trials to Help Athletes’ Mental Health
description: Beacon, a golden retriever, began working with U.S.A. Gymnastics last year as part of the organization’s efforts to transform the sport’s toxic culture. More dogs quickly followed.

title: Iranians Say Elections Bring Little Change, So Why Vote?
description: In Tehran, many Iranians said they didn’t see the point in voting in Friday’s first-round presidential election since all the candidates had been vetted by the government.

title: How Science Went to the Dogs (and Cats)
description: Pets were once dismissed as trivial scientific subjects. Today, companion animal science is hot.

title: Boeing Agrees to Buy Spirit AeroSystems, a Longtime Supplier
description: The multibillion-dollar deal will reverse a decision the plane maker made two decades ago to outsource production of key parts to independent suppliers.

title: U.S. Said to Seek Boeing Guilty Plea to Avoid Trial in 737 Max Crashes
description: The Justice Department told victims’ families that it would propose a nearly $244 million fine and three years of company oversight to settle a fraud charge.

title: Soma Golden Behr, 84, Dies; Inspired Enterprising Journalism at The Times
description: The first woman to serve as the paper’s national editor, she focused on issues of race, class and poverty, drawing prizes, and rose to the newsroom’s top echelon.

title: This Isn’t All Joe Biden’s Fault
description: What is the Democratic Party for if not for dealing with a situation like this?

title: The Ghastly vs. the Ghostly
description: Do the Democrats really want to stop Trump? What are they prepared to do?

title: To Serve His Country, President Biden Should Leave the Race
description: The president’s inadequate performance in the debate made it clear he is not the man he was four years ago.

title: The ‘Bad Debate’ Nonsense
description: Biden’s problems are far more serious than a single night’s poor performance.

title: Hurricane Beryl Threatens the Caribbean as a Category 3 Storm
description: The tropical cyclone was the earliest in a season to strengthen to a Category 4 hurricane in the Atlantic. It later weakened slightly.

title: China Dangled Rebates to Lure People to Spend. It’s Not Enough.
description: China’s leaders vowed to kick-start spending by offering subsidies for households to buy cars and appliances. But many consumers aren’t biting.

title: Along the Hollywood Walk of Fame, a Struggle to Make a Living
description: Los Angeles lifted restrictions that had forced street vendors, mostly immigrants, on Hollywood Boulevard to dodge citations. Other challenges remain.

title: Myanmar Shop Owners Are Being Jailed for Increasing Wages
description: Myanmar’s junta, facing a growing popular rebellion, has plunged the country into economic crisis, reversing gains from a decade of civilian leadership.

title: Anything Can Happen, and Usually Does, on ‘Watch What Happens Live’
description: With Andy Cohen, Hillary Clinton will do shots and Oscar-winners gush about reality stars — all savvy promotion for Bravo’s outrageous TV universe.
